title: Electric PE - two equilateral triangle systems

content.description: Two systems, each consisting of three small, charged spheres that form an equilateral triangle, are shown in the figures. All spheres have the same charge <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi></math>. In System <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, the spheres are separated by a distance <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"> <mi>D</mi> </math> from each other, and in System <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> the spheres are separated by a distance <math alttext="2 D" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>D</mi></math>.
content.question: What is the ratio <math alttext="the fraction U sub 2 over U sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac></math> of the electric potential energy of System <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"> <mn>2</mn> </math> to that of System <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>?
